title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Budget supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. During control years, the Mayor submits the budget to the President for transmission to Congress. No funds can be spent by District of Columbia government officials unless authorized by the budget. After the annual budget is adopted, no reprogramming of funds can occur without the Mayor's request and Council approval. Any additional expenditures must be offset by reductions in other activities. The term 'control year' is defined in the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. The Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to specify the length of the Congressional review period for budget acts. Acts not in a control year take effect after a 30-day period unless a joint resolution disapproving the act is enacted. If neither House is in session, the period is extended by 5 days. The Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to extend the Congressional review period for budget acts by 5 days. Joint resolutions disapproving an act must pass both Houses of Congress within the specified period to repeal the act. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act. The Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to extend the Congressional review period for budget acts by 5 days. Various sections of the Act are amended to reflect the changes. SEC. 446 Enactment of local budget. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to change the wording regarding transmission to the President of the United States. A new term 'control year' is defined in the subsection. Additionally, employees can now be hired if the position is authorized by an Act of the Council. Section 447 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to replace references to "Act of Congress" with "act of the Council (or Act of Congress, in the case of a control year)." Other conforming amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process are also made. Section 603 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to give federal authority over the budget-making process for control years. Restrictions are placed on approving budgets not consistent with the financial plan. The term "control year" is defined in relation to the Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. SEC. 6. CONTINUATION OF GENERAL PROVISIONS IN APPROPRIATIONS ACTS. Any general provision in a general appropriation bill regarding Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments apply to District of Columbia budgets starting from October 1, 2004.
